Crime_Type: Human Rights Violations and Serious International Law Offenses
Outcome: The Board erred in law by excluding the applicant under Article 1(F)(a)
Grounds_for_Claim: Applicant claimed refugee status based on political opinion
Standard_of_Review: Legality of Board's decision under international law
Evidence_Requirement: Evidence of widespread, systematic targeting of a civilian group; direct participation or complicity in crimes against humanity
Decision_Outcome: Judicial review application dismissed due to lack of grounds on persecution claim
Institutional_Action: Immigration and Refugee Board reviewed and excluded the applicant
Government_Body_or_Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board, Federal Court
Evidence_Type: Organizational affiliation, nature of EPR activities
Jurisdiction: Federal Court jurisdiction over refugee claims
Nature_of_Participation: Alleged membership and involvement with EPR
Legal_Statute: Article 1(F)(a) of the Convention relating to the Status of Refugees
Assessment_Standard: Whether acts constitute crimes against humanity under international law
Legal_Standard: Crimes against humanity require widespread and systematic attacks
Protection_Claim: Refugee protection based on political opinion
Risk_Factor: Persecution risk due to political opinion
Credibility: Credibility issues upheld by the Board

Crime_Name: Participation in activities of a terrorist group
National_Security_Element: Terrorist activities involving attacks and killings of civilians
National_Security_Danger: Threat posed by association with EPR
Threat_Assessment: EPR conducted attacks and killed civilians
Risk_Factor: Association with a violent non-state actor
Nature_of_Membership: General involvement without evidence of direct participation in atrocities
Evidence_Type: Affiliation with EPR, nature of group's actions
Key_Evidence_Issue: Lack of evidence linking applicant to systematic crimes or terrorism
Evidence_Credibility: Board found credibility issues were reasonably addressed
Credibility_Factors: Consistency of testimony, plausibility of claims
Evidence_Issues: Insufficient proof of complicity in crimes against humanity
Standard_of_Proof: Preponderance of evidence standard in administrative proceedings
Legal_Standard: Complicity requires more than mere membership if purpose is brutal and limited
Decision_Outcome: Judicial review dismissed despite legal error due to credibility findings
Process: Refugee determination process with judicial review
Procedural_Element: Hearing before Immigration and Refugee Board
Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness standard applied by Federal Court
Review_Standard: Reasonableness of Board's factual and legal conclusions
Reasoning_Deficiency: Error in applying Article 1(F)(a) without sufficient evidence of crimes against humanity
Deportation_Risk: Potential removal due to exclusion from refugee status
